context: Forward-facing dashcam view of a two-lane urban street with parked cars on both sides and a small traffic island in the middle.
perception: The road is a two-way street with one lane in each direction, separated by a small traffic island with a blue sign indicating vehicles must keep right. There are parked cars along both sides of the street. A white car is directly ahead in the same lane, moving forward. The weather is clear and visibility is good. There is a pedestrian crosswalk visible on the right side of the street, but no pedestrians are currently crossing. The traffic appears light with no immediate obstacles or traffic signals visible.
prediction: The white car ahead will continue driving straight along the lane. No pedestrians are expected to cross imminently. Traffic conditions will likely remain stable in the next few seconds.
planning: Maintain current lane and speed, keeping a safe following distance behind the white car. Prepare to slow down if the car ahead brakes or if pedestrians appear near the crosswalk.
